claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Table listing influenza vaccines by trade name, presentation, age indication, HA content per virus antigen per dose, route, and mercury content. Includes IIV4 (Fluzone Quadrivalent) with 15 µg HA per virus and RIV4 (Flublok Quadrivalent) with 45 µg HA per virus. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent shows 45 µg HA per virus antigen per 0.5 mL dose versus 15 µg for standard-dose IIV4 vaccines. The table demonstrates that Flublok contains 3× the HA antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines but does not provide any data or statements on immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in full. Note: No immunogenicity data are presented in the image; table text is clear and legible.
